newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela's Telcel to invest $84 mln in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela's Telcel to invest $84 mln in 1997.

text.p: Venezuelan cellular telephone company Telcel which controls some 60 percent of the Venezuelan market will invest $84 million in 1997, $10 million more than this year, company Executive President Oswaldo Cisneros said.
The amount, although agreed by the Board of Directors, has to be approved by shareholders at a general meeting next Tuesday, Cisneros told reporters at an oil conference in Caracas.

Telcel competes directly in Venezuela with CANTV subsidiary Movilnet. The Venezuelan government is due to sell its 49 percent stake in CANTV this Friday in one of the largest public offerings to come out of Latin America this year.
